work.name: Ora Medical
work.summary:
• Developed and maintained robust software solutions for medical applications, following standard operating procedures and complying with various regulatory systems
• Developed a Web platform in React used by medical professionals for remote monitoring of patients with walking disabilities. The platform enhances patient care by enabling personalized treatment plans and timely interventions, while requiring fewer resources
• Worked on a mobile application in React Native used by the patients. The app communicates with a MetaWear sensor worn by the individual, collecting a wide range of data related to their walking patterns
• Wrote custom React Native modules in Kotlin (Android) and Swift (iOS) to properly initialize the MetaWear device
• Contributed to MbientLab’s Android MetaWear SDK (Java) to add the step counter and activity detection functionnalities to MetaWear devices using the BMI270 sensor
• Designed a database using MongoDB Atlas App Services. Used GraphQL for queries on the Web platform and MongoDB Realm for the local database on the mobile application

work.name: Amazon
work.summary:
I researched, designed and implemented a new feature for Amazon's customer service web application.

• Migrated the gift card locking feature to Amazon’s new customer service internal platform in order to reduce dependency on legacy code as part of the ongoing platform upgrade
• Designed and implemented a GraphQL schema to integrate the new user interface (React) with the gift card locking functionality. Wrote Java code using a proprietary Amazon framework to handle the gift card locking requests
• Played a key role in the ongoing platform upgrade by reducing technical debt and ensuring compatibility with modern technologies.
• Created a design document explaining the different requirements and the steps to complete the project

work.name: Google
work.summary:
• Contributed to Fuchsia, Google’s open-source operating system
• Developed Rust-based "ffx plugins", command-line tools used for debugging Fuchsia components
• Improved the functionality and readability of existing commands by refactoring their code and 
output format. This made them simpler to use by other developers and enhanced their utility.
• Created new debugging commands in Rust to analyze running Fuchsia components
• Implemented in Rust a feature that generates Rust or C++ code to conditionally compile the inspect code in Fuchsia components, allowing them to share information about their health and configuration

https://github.com/tran-simon/fuchsia/commits?author=tran-simon
https://fuchsia-review.googlesource.com/q/owner:transimon@google.com+status:merged

work.name: Vélocité Conseil
work.summary:
• Led the development of Hazy Brewing app, a React (TypeScript) web application for amateur and professional brewers
• Created a recipe creation and management system, an inventory manager and a brew scheduler to facilitate beer production
• Implemented support for multiple authenticated users within organizations using Firebase Authentication, enabling collaborative brewing
• Built a system to import beer recipes from other brewing softwares using a custom algorithm for ingredient matching
• Integrated the Stripe payment gateway for secure and reliable in-app purchases

I spent a few months working with a fellow dev, but for the most part I was the sole developer on the project. I was in charge of making all the important architectural and design decisions. This experience gave me confidence and decision making skills. I've also greatly improved my communication skills, since I often had to propose new ideas, discuss possible implementations and even argue with the project manager when I thought some decisions were wrong.

Thanks to this experience, I'm now able to create by myself a medium-sized React application. I can handle most parts of a fullstack project including the UI design, database structure, the actual coding in typescript, the deployment in Firebase, the security, accessibility and many more.
